item.name: Abyssal Hunter
item.text: {B}, {T}: Tap target creature. Abyssal Hunter deals damage equal to Abyssal Hunter's power to that creature.
item.flavorText: Some smiles show cheer; some merely show teeth.

item.name: Acidic Dagger
item.text: {4}, {T}: Whenever target creature deals combat damage to a non-Wall creature this turn, destroy that non-Wall creature. When the targeted creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Acidic Dagger. Activate this ability only during combat before blockers are declared.

item.name: Afiya Grove
item.text: Afiya Grove enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, move a +1/+1 counter from Afiya Grove onto target creature. When Afiya Grove has no +1/+1 counters on it, sacrifice it.

item.name: Afterlife
item.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller puts a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: Facets of life, reflections of the soul.

item.name: Agility
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has flanking. (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)

item.name: Alarum
item.text: Untap target nonattacking creature. It gets +1/+3 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "One timely cry of warning can save nine of surprise." —Sidar Jabari

item.name: Aleatory
item.text: Cast Aleatory only during combat after blockers are declared. Flip a coin. If you win the flip, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

item.name: Amber Prison
item.text: You may choose not to untap Amber Prison during your untap step. {4}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land. That permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Amber Prison remains tapped.

item.name: Amulet of Unmaking
item.text: {5}, {T}, Exile Amulet of Unmaking: Exile target artifact, creature, or land. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
item.flavorText: Trade to trade, not to keep. —Suq'Ata motto

item.name: Ancestral Memories
item.text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
item.flavorText: "Even the ancient storytellers proclaimed Zhalfir to be dominant over all Jamuraa. Kaervek's invasion shocked us all." —Hakim, Loreweaver

item.name: Armor of Thorns
item.text: You may cast Armor of Thorns as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step. Enchant nonblack creature Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

item.name: Armorer Guildmage
item.text: {B}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn. {G}, {T}: Target creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Zhalfir's destiny rings in tempered steel. —Armorer Guild maxim

item.name: Ashen Powder
item.text: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
item.flavorText: "What you call decay, I call ripening. You'll gain no sustenance from this harvest." —Kaervek

item.name: Asmira, Holy Avenger
item.text: Flying At the beginning of each end step, put a +1/+1 counter on Asmira, Holy Avenger for each creature put into your graveyard from the battlefield this turn.
item.flavorText: "Omens lie in this early harvest's fruit." —Asmira, Holy Avenger

item.name: Auspicious Ancestor
item.text: When Auspicious Ancestor is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you gain 3 life. Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

item.name: Azimaet Drake
item.text: Flying {U}: Azimaet Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
item.flavorText: "A vizier's dish, best served drenched in honey and almonds." —Suq'Ata royal recipe

item.name: Bad River
item.text: Bad River enters the battlefield tapped. {T}, Sacrifice Bad River: Search your library for an Island or Swamp card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

item.name: Barbed Foliage
item.text:
Whenever a creature attacks you, it loses flanking until end of turn.
Whenever a creature without flying attacks you, Barbed Foliage deals 1 damage to it.

item.name: Barbed-Back Wurm
item.text: {B}: Target green creature blocking Barbed-Back Wurm gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "The Mwonvuli Jungle has given the darkness teeth for tearing the gift of life from the weak." —Jolrael

item.name: Barreling Attack
item.text: Target creature gains trample until end of turn. When that creature becomes blocked this turn, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
item.flavorText: "The trollish game of push-fall inspired this impressive tactic." —Sidar Jabari

item.name: Basalt Golem
item.text: Basalt Golem can't be blocked by artifact creatures. Whenever Basalt Golem becomes blocked by a creature, that creature's controller sacrifices it at end of combat. If the player does, he or she puts a 0/2 colorless Wall artifact creature token with defender onto the battlefield.

item.name: Bay Falcon
item.text: Flying, vigilance
item.flavorText: "Wear the falcon's feathers in your hair— be fast as the falcon, bright as the Sun." —"Rise on Wings," Zhalfirin song

item.name: Bazaar of Wonders
item.text: When Bazaar of Wonders enters the battlefield, exile all cards from all graveyards. Whenever a player casts a spell, counter it if a card with the same name is in a graveyard or a nontoken permanent with the same name is on the battlefield.

item.name: Benevolent Unicorn
item.text: If a spell would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals that much damage minus 1 to that creature or player instead.
item.flavorText: The best use for a unicorn's horn is to adorn a unicorn. —Femeref adage

item.name: Benthic Djinn
item.text:
Islandwalk
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.
item.flavorText: "In all my years I've only met one mage who successfully trapped a djinn—and none who tried and failed." —Talibah, embermage

item.name: Binding Agony
item.text: Enchant creature Whenever enchanted creature is dealt damage, Binding Agony deals that much damage to that creature's controller.
item.flavorText: A crash of rhinos in my head —Femeref expression meaning "a severe head pain"

item.name: Blighted Shaman
item.text: {T}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

item.name: Blind Fury
item.text: Cast Blind Fury only before the combat damage step. All creatures lose trample until end of turn. If a creature would deal combat damage to a creature this turn, it deals double that damage to that creature instead.
item.flavorText: "Tell me . . . have you ever sung the Song of Blood?" —Purraj of Urborg

item.name: Blinding Light
item.text: Tap all nonwhite creatures.
item.flavorText: "My shield will bear a shining sun so you will always be with me. / Inlaid with gold, it will shine like glowing embers." —"Love Song of Night and Day"

item.name: Blistering Barrier
item.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
item.flavorText: I live without food, stand without leg, wound without force, and am harder to fight than to kill. What am I? —Femeref riddle

item.name: Bone Harvest
item.text: Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
item.flavorText: "Only fools believe they will face my armies but once." —Kaervek

item.name: Bone Mask
item.text: {2}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. For each 1 damage prevented this way, exile the top card of your library.
item.flavorText: "The protection offered comes at a price. How numerous are your kin?" —Purraj of Urborg

item.name: Boomerang
item.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
item.flavorText: A lie always returns; be careful how you catch it.

item.name: Breathstealer
item.text: {B}: Breathstealer gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "As a child, I slept with a cloth over my face, to hide from the spirits that might pull the air from my lungs." —Mosi, Femeref weaver

item.name: Brushwagg
item.text: Whenever Brushwagg blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -2/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Defiantly, the young cyclops popped the brushwagg into his mouth. His cheeks suddenly puffed, his eye bulged, and he was forced to agree with his elder." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Builder's Bane
item.text: Destroy X target artifacts. Builder's Bane deals damage to each player equal to the number of artifacts he or she controlled destroyed this way.
item.flavorText: There is only so much a person may be buried with.

item.name: Burning Palm Efreet
item.text: {1}{R}{R}: Burning Palm Efreet deals 2 damage to target creature with flying and that creature loses flying until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Even the lion envies the lark.

item.name: Burning Shield Askari
item.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.) {R}{R}: Burning Shield Askari gains first strike until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Any day that I ride my horse up to my ankles in the remains of my enemies is a good day." —Akin, seasoned askari

item.name: Cadaverous Bloom
item.text: Exile a card from your hand: Add {B}{B} or {G}{G} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: "It's filthy work, planting them." —Kifimbo, Shadow Guildmage

item.name: Cadaverous Knight
item.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.) {1}{B}{B}: Regenerate Cadaverous Knight.
item.flavorText: Grieve for the soul in death dishonored. —Shadow Guild saying

item.name: Canopy Dragon
item.text: Trample {1}{G}: Canopy Dragon gains flying and loses trample until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "In the Mwonvuli you must divide your attention between what hangs overhead and what lies underfoot." —Sidar Jabari

item.name: Carrion
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Carrion, sacrifice a creature. Put X 0/1 black Insect creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the sacrificed creature's power.
item.flavorText: King or herder, the maggots care not.

item.name: Catacomb Dragon
item.text: Flying Whenever Catacomb Dragon becomes blocked by a nonartifact, non-Dragon creature, that creature gets -X/-0 until end of turn, where X is half the creature's power, rounded down.

item.name: Celestial Dawn
item.text: Lands you control are Plains. Nonland cards you own that aren't on the battlefield, spells you control, and nonland permanents you control are white. You may spend white mana as though it were mana of any color. You may spend other mana only as though it were colorless mana.

item.name: Cerulean Wyvern
item.text: Flying, protection from green
item.flavorText: "Once, a Quirion asked why I was so cautious when the day was clear. I told him of the sky-blue hide of the cerluean wyvern, and he offered me double if I could conjure a strong tailwind" —Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

item.name: Chaos Charm
item.text: Choose one — Destroy target Wall; or Chaos Charm deals 1 damage to target creature; or target creature gains haste until end of turn.

item.name: Chaosphere
item.text: Creatures with flying can block only creatures with flying. Creatures without flying have reach. (They can block creatures with flying.)
item.flavorText: "I dance the nothing dance, / Feet in the air, knives in the ground." —Femeref chant

item.name: Charcoal Diamond
item.text: Charcoal Diamond enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

item.name: Chariot of the Sun
item.text: {2}, {T}: Until end of turn, target creature you control gains flying and its toughness becomes 1.
item.flavorText: "Sun follows Moon until she tires, then carries her until she's strong / and runs ahead of him again." —"Love Song of Night and Day"

item.name: Choking Sands
item.text: Destroy target non-Swamp land. If that land was nonbasic, Choking Sands deals 2 damage to the land's controller.
item.flavorText: "The people wiped the sand from their eyes and cursed—and left the barren land to the hyenas and vipers." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Cinder Cloud
item.text: Destroy target creature. If a white creature is put into a graveyard this way, Cinder Cloud deals damage to that creature's controller equal to the creature's power.

item.name: Circle of Despair
item.text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature or player this turn, prevent that damage.
item.flavorText: "Life is a resource that should belong only to the strong." —Shauku, Endbringer

item.name: Civic Guildmage
item.text: {G}, {T}: Target creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn. {U}, {T}: Put target creature you control on top of its owner's library.
item.flavorText: To condemn the innocent you must first condemn yourself. —Civic Guild maxim

item.name: Cloak of Invisibility
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature has phasing and can't be blocked except by Walls. (It phases in or out before its controller untaps during each of his or her untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
item.flavorText: "Useful . . . if you can find it." —Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

item.name: Consuming Ferocity
item.text: Enchant non-Wall creature Enchanted creature gets +1/+0. At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+0 counter on enchanted creature. If that creature has three or more +1/+0 counters on it, it deals damage equal to its power to its controller, then destroy that creature and it can't be regenerated.

item.name: Coral Fighters
item.text: Whenever Coral Fighters attacks and isn't blocked, look at the top card of defending player's library. You may put that card on the bottom of that player's library.

item.name: Crash of Rhinos
item.text: Trample
item.flavorText: Love is like a rhino, short-sighted and hasty; if it cannot find a way, it will make a way. —Femeref adage

item.name: Crimson Hellkite
item.text:
Flying
{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana this way.
item.flavorText: "Dragonfire forged me a warrior." —Rashida Scalebane

item.name: Crimson Roc
item.text: Flying Whenever Crimson Roc blocks a creature without flying, Crimson Roc gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

item.name: Crypt Cobra
item.text: Whenever Crypt Cobra attacks and isn't blocked, defending player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

item.name: Crystal Golem
item.text: At the beginning of your end step, Crystal Golem phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
item.flavorText: "Once, a wealthy king commissioned an artificial creature to be crafted from the royal treasury, thinking it a clever ploy to have the jewels guard themselves." —Azeworai, "The Golem's Wish"

item.name: Crystal Vein
item.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Crystal Vein: Add {2} to your mana pool.

item.name: Cursed Totem
item.text: Activated abilities of creatures can't be activated.
item.flavorText: Pass me from soul to soul / soldier to herder, herder to beast, beast to soil / until I am everywhere. / Then pass me those souls. —Totem inscription (translated)

item.name: Cycle of Life
item.text: Return Cycle of Life to its owner's hand: Target creature you cast this turn becomes 0/1 until your next upkeep. At the beginning of your next upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
item.flavorText: Thus does nature assert herself.

item.name: Daring Apprentice
item.text: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.
item.flavorText: In front of every great wizard is a doomed apprentice.

item.name: Dark Banishing
item.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
item.flavorText: "Femeref was guided by the wisdom of the Council of Voices. But in one terrible instant, they were slain, leaving Asmira as the sole voice of leadership." —Hakim, Loreweaver

item.name: Dark Ritual
item.text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
item.flavorText: "The ceremony ended with a voice from the shadows, a voice with vast, ominous power." —Kifimbo, Shadow Guildmage

item.name: Dazzling Beauty
item.text: Cast Dazzling Beauty only during the declare blockers step. Target attacking unblocked creature becomes blocked. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

item.name: Decomposition
item.text: Enchant black creature Enchanted creature has "Cumulative upkeep—Pay 1 life." (At the beginning of its controller's upkeep, that player puts an age counter on it, then sacrifices it unless he or she pays its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.) When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, its controller loses 2 life.

item.name: Delirium
item.text: Cast Delirium only during an opponent's turn. Tap target creature that player controls. That creature deals damage equal to its power to the player. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by the creature this turn.

item.name: Dirtwater Wraith
item.text:
Swampwalk
{B}: Dirtwater Wraith gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "The foul entities of the Uuserk swamp had never before dared to spread their influence to the very heart of Zhalfir." —Hakim, Loreweaver

item.name: Discordant Spirit
item.text: At the beginning of each end step, if it's an opponent's turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Discordant Spirit for each 1 damage dealt to you this turn. At the beginning of your end step, remove all +1/+1 counters on Discordant Spirit.

item.name: Disempower
item.text: Put target artifact or enchantment on top of its owner's library.
item.flavorText: "Mangara is gone. Who among you doubts that I have taken his power?" —Kaervek

item.name: Disenchant
item.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
item.flavorText: "There are harsher ways to learn the meaning of the word ‘no.'" —Rashida Scalebane

item.name: Dissipate
item.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
item.flavorText: "If you weren't born with it, you don't need it." —Grahilah, former trader of Amiqat

item.name: Divine Offering
item.text: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
item.flavorText: "Suq'Ata believe in trade; Femeref, alms; Zhalfirins, steel. Be warned, Kaervek—now we are joined." —Sidar Jabari

item.name: Divine Retribution
item.text: Divine Retribution deals damage to target attacking creature equal to the number of attacking creatures.
item.flavorText: "To the undiscerning eye, justice and vengeance can look the same." —Rashida Scalebane

item.name: Drain Life
item.text: Spend only black mana on X. Drain Life deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before Drain Life dealt damage or the creature's toughness.

item.name: Dread Specter
item.text: Whenever Dread Specter blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
item.flavorText: Whatever follows life is incurable. —Zhalfirin aphorism

item.name: Dream Cache
item.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand both on top of your library or both on the bottom of your library.
item.flavorText: Dreams' riches are easily spent. —Suq'Ata adage

item.name: Dream Fighter
item.text: Whenever Dream Fighter blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Dream Fighter and that creature phase out. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. Each one phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)
item.flavorText: Not only the sleeping should fear dreams.

item.name: Dwarven Miner
item.text: {2}{R}, {T}: Destroy target nonbasic land.
item.flavorText: "Fetch the pestridder, Paka—we've got dwarves in the rutabagas" —Jamul, Femeref farmer

item.name: Dwarven Nomad
item.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.
item.flavorText: A dwarf's life belongs as much to the land as to the dwarf. —Creed of the Stonethrow Clan

item.name: Early Harvest
item.text: Target player untaps all basic lands he or she controls.
item.flavorText: "Tonight we'll eat a farewell feast. Cold corn porridge is not enough. / Let's peel papayas, pineapples, and mangoes, drink coconut milk, / and bake bananas." —"Love Song of Night and Day"

item.name: Ebony Charm
item.text: Choose one — Target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life; or exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard; or target creature gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

item.name: Ekundu Cyclops
item.text: If a creature you control attacks, Ekundu Cyclops also attacks if able.
item.flavorText: "Big one I, One big eye. One-eye see Two-eye die" —Traditional cyclops chant

item.name: Ekundu Griffin
item.text: Flying, first strike
item.flavorText: "My goat was a small price to pay for the chance to see the hunting griffin dive and seize it." —Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

item.name: Elixir of Vitality
item.text: Elixir of Vitality enters the battlefield tapped. {T}, Sacrifice Elixir of Vitality: You gain 4 life. {8}, {T}, Sacrifice Elixir of Vitality: You gain 8 life.
item.flavorText: "Eternal life or your money back." —Unnamed Suq'Ata merchant, deceased

item.name: Emberwilde Caliph
item.text:
Flying, trample
Emberwilde Caliph attacks each turn if able.
Whenever Emberwilde Caliph deals damage, you lose that much life.
item.flavorText: The fire breathes while the air burns.

item.name: Emberwilde Djinn
item.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may pay {R}{R} or 2 life. If he or she does, the player gains control of Emberwilde Djinn.
item.flavorText: A hefty price is no guarantee of quality merchandise.

item.name: Energy Bolt
item.text: Choose one — Energy Bolt deals X damage to target player; or target player gains X life.
item.flavorText: Life and death are two faces of the same coin.

item.name: Energy Vortex
item.text: As Energy Vortex enters the battlefield, choose an opponent. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove all energy counters from Energy Vortex. At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Energy Vortex deals 3 damage to that player unless he or she pays {1} for each energy counter on Energy Vortex. {X}: Put X energy counters on Energy Vortex. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

item.name: Enfeeblement
item.text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
item.flavorText: "If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it." —Kaervek

item.name: Enlightened Tutor
item.text: Search your library for an artifact or enchantment card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
item.flavorText: "I do not teach. I simply reveal." —Daudi, Femeref tutor

item.name: Ersatz Gnomes
item.text:
{T}: Target spell is colorless.
{T}: Target permanent becomes colorless until end of turn.
item.flavorText: From jungle to sea, from sea to stone, from stone to field, from field to bone. What am I? Zhalfirin riddle

item.name: Ether Well
item.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library. If that creature is red, you may put it on the bottom of its owner's library instead.
item.flavorText: "Whoa—my tail will never fit through that hole"

item.name: Ethereal Champion
item.text: Pay 1 life: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ethereal Champion this turn.
item.flavorText: "If I have learned anything as a wizard it is this: never fight your own battles." —Waffa, sorcerer of Nyomba

item.name: Fallow Earth
item.text: Put target land on top of its owner's library.
item.flavorText: ". . . and when the farmer awoke the next morning, all the seeds from his field were once again in their sacks." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Favorable Destiny
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +1/+2 as long as it's white. Enchanted creature has shroud as long as its controller controls another creature. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

item.name: Femeref Archers
item.text: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.
item.flavorText: "They say a Zhalfirin archer can split the eye of a griffin. Nonsense, of course: they have no faith to guide their darts." —Nuru, Femeref archer

item.name: Femeref Healer
item.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
item.flavorText: "Faith is my shield, and hope is my armor; I am vulnerable only to myself." —Asmira, Holy Avenger

item.name: Femeref Knight
item.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.) {W}: Femeref Knight gains vigilance until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "I will return / with lizard skins for your sandals. Paint your eyes black and wait for me." "Love Song of Night and Day"

item.name: Femeref Scouts
item.flavorText: "The days before the war were filled with strange portents: scouts and herders spoke of villages reduced to ash, of farmers taken from their fields, and of foul beasts roaming the plains in packs. I know, for I spoke to them all." —Hakim, Loreweaver

item.name: Feral Shadow
item.text: Flying
item.flavorText: "The night stalkers are such a minor power in Urborg. Their sad eagerness to elevate themselves makes them willing tools in the plundering of little Femeref." —Kaervek

item.name: Fetid Horror
item.text: {B}: Fetid Horror gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Of the six who went down the Uuserek Trail to scout ahead, one returned. She clawed at her eyes and nostrils and sobbed with horror. I was curious about what she saw, but we chose another path." —Scout Ekemet, final journal

item.name: Final Fortune
item.text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
item.flavorText: Want all, lose all. —Zhalfirin aphorism

item.name: Fire Diamond
item.text: Fire Diamond enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

item.name: Firebreathing
item.text: Enchant creature {R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Magic's only part of it, my friend. Diet does the rest." —Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

item.name: Flame Elemental
item.text: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice Flame Elemental: Flame Elemental deals damage equal to its power to target creature.
item.flavorText: Storyteller: By my hand in the fire, this story is a tale of power. Listeners: May it give you strength.

item.name: Flare
item.text:
Flare deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
item.flavorText: "In the forest, fires light the sky as black clouds unfold their weight." —"Love Song of Night and Day"

item.name: Flash
item.text: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. If you do, sacrifice it unless you pay its mana cost reduced by up to {2}.

item.name: Flood Plain
item.text: Flood Plain enters the battlefield tapped. {T}, Sacrifice Flood Plain: Search your library for a Plains or Island card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

item.name: Floodgate
item.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.) When Floodgate has flying, sacrifice it. When Floodgate leaves the battlefield, it deals damage equal to half the number of Islands you control, rounded down, to each nonblue creature without flying.
item.flavorText: "Quick, Rhirhok—teach me to swim" —Makht, goblin casualty

item.name: Fog
item.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
item.flavorText: "More armies have been lost in the confusion of the jungle mists than to any battle." —Jolrael

item.name: Foratog
item.text: {G}, Sacrifice a Forest: Foratog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: Five hundred years to grow—barely a minute to eat.

item.name: Forbidden Crypt
item.text: If you would draw a card, return a card from your graveyard to your hand instead. If you can't, you lose the game. If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere, exile that card instead.

item.text: G

item.name: Forsaken Wastes
item.text: Players can't gain life. At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player loses 1 life. Whenever Forsaken Wastes becomes the target of a spell, that spell's controller loses 5 life.

item.name: Frenetic Efreet
item.text: Flying {0}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, Frenetic Efreet phases out. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Frenetic Efreet. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)

item.name: Giant Mantis
item.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
item.flavorText: "I hate insects of every sort. The only mercy is that they are generally small." —Mwani, Mtenda goatherd

item.name: Gibbering Hyenas
item.text: Gibbering Hyenas can't block black creatures.
item.flavorText: Hyenas laughing—what's the joke? —Femeref phrase meaning "that's not funny"

item.name: Goblin Elite Infantry
item.text: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: They talk a good fight.

item.name: Goblin Scouts
item.text: Put three 1/1 red Goblin Scout creature tokens with mountainwalk onto the battlefield.
item.flavorText: "Pathetic—like I wouldn't know a goblin painted up to look like a dwarf" —Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

item.name: Goblin Soothsayer
item.text: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Red creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "I see a great victory and rivers of blood. And . . . hmm, looks like a spleen." —Grishnak, goblin soothsayer

item.name: Goblin Tinkerer
item.text: {R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact. That artifact deals damage equal to its converted mana cost to Goblin Tinkerer.
item.flavorText: "Can they do that?" —Imwita, Zhalfirin artificer, last words

item.name: Granger Guildmage
item.text: {W}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn. {R}, {T}: Granger Guildmage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.
item.flavorText: Leave no mouth agape, no stomach unfilled. —Granger Guild maxim

item.name: Grasslands
item.text: Grasslands enters the battlefield tapped. {T}, Sacrifice Grasslands: Search your library for a Forest or Plains card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

item.name: Grave Servitude
item.text: You may cast Grave Servitude as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step. Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +3/-1 and is black.
item.flavorText: "I no longer believe in a final resting place." —Shauku, Endbringer

item.name: Gravebane Zombie
item.text: If Gravebane Zombie would be put into a graveyard from the battlefield, put Gravebane Zombie on top of its owner's library instead.
item.flavorText: "A zombie's bed must be a lumpy one or he wouldn't leave it so often." —Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

item.name: Grim Feast
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Grim Feast deals 1 damage to you. Whenever a creature is put into an opponent's graveyard from the battlefield, you gain life equal to its toughness.
item.flavorText: "Hmmm—midnight snack."

item.name: Grinning Totem
item.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Grinning Totem: Search target opponent's library for a card and exile it. Then that player shuffles his or her library. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card. At the beginning of your next upkeep, if you haven't played it, put it into its owner's graveyard.

item.name: Hakim, Loreweaver
item.text: Flying {U}{U}: Return target Aura card from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to Hakim, Loreweaver. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only if Hakim isn't enchanted. {U}{U}, {T}: Destroy all Auras attached to Hakim.

item.name: Hall of Gemstone
item.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses a color. Until end of turn, lands tapped for mana produce mana of the chosen color instead of any other color.

item.name: Hammer of Bogardan
item.text: Hammer of Bogardan deals 3 damage to target creature or player. {2}{R}{R}{R}: Return Hammer of Bogardan from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

item.name: Harbinger of Night
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on each creature.
item.flavorText: Embrace the Harbinger —Suq'Ata expression meaning "abandon hope"

item.name: Harbor Guardian
item.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.) Whenever Harbor Guardian attacks, defending player may draw a card.
item.flavorText: "Our guardian levies a tax on all traders. Wise travelers pay with a minimum of fuss." —Qhattib, Vizier of Amiqat

item.name: Harmattan Efreet
item.text:
Flying
{1}{U}{U}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "One moment I was walking along the beach, and the next I was high in the air, staring into a hideous smiling face." —Tarub, Suq'Ata sailor

item.name: Haunting Apparition
item.text: Flying As Haunting Apparition enters the battlefield, choose an opponent. Haunting Apparition's power is equal to 1 plus the number of green creature cards in the chosen player's graveyard.
item.flavorText: Like some foul herdbeast, it grazes on the dead.

item.name: Hazerider Drake
item.text: Flying, protection from red
item.flavorText: "The hazerider danced in the thunderstorm and sang to its music." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Healing Salve
item.text: Choose one — Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
item.flavorText: "The Femeref look only to the Sun for healing; they have never truly understood life's cycle." —Kifimbo, Shadow Guildmage

item.name: Hivis of the Scale
item.text: You may choose not to untap Hivis of the Scale during your untap step. {T}: Gain control of target Dragon for as long as you control Hivis and Hivis remains tapped.

item.name: Horrible Hordes
item.text: Rampage 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
item.flavorText: Few are able to underestimate the hordes.

item.name: Igneous Golem
item.text: {2}: Igneous Golem gains trample until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "The creature rose from the mountain, its body weeping fire." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Illicit Auction
item.text: Each player may bid life for control of target creature. You start the bidding with a bid of 0. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid and gains control of the creature. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

item.name: Illumination
item.text: Counter target artifact or enchantment spell. Its controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.
item.flavorText: "A brilliant light can either illuminate or blind. How will you know which until you open your eyes?" —Asmira, Holy Avenger

item.name: Incinerate
item.text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
item.flavorText: "Never taunt an embermage, ‘What are you going to do about it?'" —Akin, seasoned askari

item.name: Infernal Contract
item.text: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.
item.flavorText: "But I signed nothing" —Taraneh, Suq'Ata mage

item.name: Iron Tusk Elephant
item.text: Trample

item.name: Ivory Charm
item.text: Choose one — All creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn; or tap target creature; or prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

item.name: Jabari's Influence
item.text: Cast Jabari's Influence only after combat. Gain control of target nonartifact, nonblack creature that attacked you this turn and put a -1/-0 counter on it.
item.flavorText: "Common soldiers can't understand what a sidar knows: the enemy can be a resource." —Sidar Jabari

item.name: Jolrael's Centaur
item.text: Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.) Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
item.flavorText: "What need have I for cavalry when I can have horse and rider both in one?" —Jolrael

item.name: Jolt
item.text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
item.flavorText: "There's nothing like a sudden shock to clarify one's thoughts." —Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

item.name: Jungle Patrol
item.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Put a 0/1 green Wall creature token with defender named Wood onto the battlefield. Sacrifice a token named Wood: Add {R} to your mana pool.

item.name: Jungle Troll
item.text:
{R}: Regenerate Jungle Troll.
{G}: Regenerate Jungle Troll.
item.flavorText: "You eat plants; I eat plants. You eat beasts; I eat you." —Drulvurg, troll king

item.name: Jungle Wurm
item.text: Whenever Jungle Wurm becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.
item.flavorText: Broad as a baobab—and about as smart.

item.name: Kaervek's Hex
item.text: Kaervek's Hex deals 1 damage to each nonblack creature and an additional 1 damage to each green creature.
item.flavorText: "If the curse does not strike you dead, question your soul." —Kaervek

item.name: Kaervek's Purge
item.text: Destroy target creature with converted mana cost X. If that creature is put into a graveyard this way, Kaervek's Purge deals damage equal to the creature's power to the creature's controller.

item.name: Kaervek's Torch
item.text: As long as Kaervek's Torch is on the stack, spells that target it cost {2} more to cast. Kaervek's Torch deals X damage to target creature or player.
item.flavorText: The pulsing heat of the midday Sun burns in the Lion's eye. —Stone inscription, source unkown

item.name: Karoo Meerkat
item.text: Protection from blue
item.flavorText: "Be like the meerkat, my daughters: ever vigilant, true to your own, and wary of strangers." —Nabil Alamat, Suq'Ata merchant

item.name: Kukemssa Pirates
item.text: Whenever Kukemssa Pirates attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain control of target artifact defending player controls. If you do, Kukemssa Pirates assigns no combat damage this turn.
item.flavorText: ". . . pirates gambled with a djinn and lost the thing more dear than gold." —"Love Song of Night and Day"

item.name: Kukemssa Serpent
item.text:
Kukemssa Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{U}, Sacrifice an Island: Target land an opponent controls becomes an Island until end of turn.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Kukemssa Serpent.

item.name: Lead Golem
item.text: Whenever Lead Golem attacks, it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
item.flavorText: Slow and heavy swings the club.

item.name: Leering Gargoyle
item.text:
Flying
{T}: Leering Gargoyle gets -2/+2 and loses flying until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "Only a gargoyle would take such delight in a thunderstorm." —Qhattib, Vizier of Amiqat

item.name: Lightning Reflexes
item.text: You may cast Lightning Reflexes as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step. Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
item.flavorText: "Inhale. Kill. Exhale."

item.name: Lion's Eye Diamond
item.text: Sacrifice Lion's Eye Diamond, Discard your hand: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool. Activate this ability only any time you could cast an instant.
item.flavorText: Held in the lion's eye —Zhalfirin saying meaning "caught in the moment of crisis"

item.name: Locust Swarm
item.text: Flying {G}: Regenerate Locust Swarm. {G}: Untap Locust Swarm. Activate this ability only once each turn.
item.flavorText: Better a fierce thunderhead than a sky filled with locusts.

item.name: Lure of Prey
item.text: Cast Lure of Prey only if an opponent cast a creature spell this turn. You may put a green creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

item.name: Malignant Growth
item.text: Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.) At the beginning of your upkeep, put a growth counter on Malignant Growth. At the beginning of each opponent's draw step, that player draws an additional card for each growth counter on Malignant Growth, then Malignant Growth deals damage to the player equal to the number of cards he or she drew this way.

item.name: Mana Prism
item.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

item.name: Mangara's Blessing
item.text: You gain 5 life. When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Mangara's Blessing, you gain 2 life, and you return Mangara's Blessing from your graveyard to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.

item.name: Mangara's Equity
item.text: As Mangara's Equity enters the battlefield, choose black or red. At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Mangara's Equity unless you pay {1}{W}. Whenever a creature of the chosen color deals damage to you or a white creature you control, Mangara's Equity deals that much damage to that creature.

item.name: Mangara's Tome
item.text: When Mangara's Tome enters the battlefield, search your library for five cards, exile them in a face-down pile, and shuffle that pile. Then shuffle your library. {2}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead put the top card of the exiled pile into its owner's hand.

item.name: Marble Diamond
item.text: Marble Diamond enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

item.name: Maro
item.text: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
item.flavorText: No two see the same Maro.

item.name: Meddle
item.text: If target spell has only one target and that target is a creature, change that spell's target to another creature.
item.flavorText: "Shadimir was as surprised as he was relieved when the blow turned aside." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Melesse Spirit
item.text: Flying, protection from black
item.flavorText: Like a laughing knife, immaculate and sharp, is the Melesse.

item.name: Memory Lapse
item.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
item.flavorText: "The caliph was so intelligent he could not remember what he knew." —Azeworai, "Three Riddles"

item.name: Merfolk Raiders
item.text: Islandwalk Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
item.flavorText: "Turn your back for a second and they just vanish As if they weren't shifty enough before." —Rhirhok, goblin archer

item.name: Merfolk Seer
item.text: When Merfolk Seer is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, draw a card.
item.flavorText: The sea leaves no room for tears. —Zhalfirin adage

item.name: Mind Bend
item.text: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

item.name: Mind Harness
item.text: Enchant red or green creature Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.) You control enchanted creature.
item.flavorText: Centuries ago, Mangara won the loyalty of the Quirion not by ruling their minds but by supporting their independence.

item.name: Mindbender Spores
item.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.) Flying Whenever Mindbender Spores blocks a creature, put four fungus counters on that creature. The creature gains "This creature doesn't untap during your untap step if it has a fungus counter on it" and "At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fungus counter from this creature."

item.name: Mire Shade
item.text: {B}, Sacrifice a Swamp: Put a +1/+1 counter on Mire Shade. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
item.flavorText: "We realized the bog had not given up a soul but had come to claim a new one." —Scout Ekemet, final journal

item.name: Misers' Cage
item.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has five or more cards in hand, Misers' Cage deals 2 damage to him or her.
item.flavorText: "Let him be imprisoned while his possessions wander free." —Suq'Ata legal decree

item.name: Mist Dragon
item.text: {0}: Mist Dragon gains flying. (This effect lasts indefinitely.) {0}: Mist Dragon loses flying. (This effect lasts indefinitely.) {3}{U}{U}: Mist Dragon phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
item.flavorText: "Across the plains, farmers who braved the mists began to vanish. Most blamed the goblins; none guessed the truth." —Hakim, Loreweaver

item.name: Moss Diamond
item.text: Moss Diamond enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

item.text: R

item.name: Mountain Valley
item.text: Mountain Valley enters the battlefield tapped. {T}, Sacrifice Mountain Valley: Search your library for a Mountain or Forest card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

item.name: Mtenda Griffin
item.text: Flying {W}, {T}: Return Mtenda Griffin to its owner's hand and return target Griffin card from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
item.flavorText: "Unlike Zhalfir, the griffin needs no council to keep harmony among its parts."Asmira, Holy Avenger

item.name: Mtenda Herder
item.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
item.flavorText: "All animals—even humans—can be herded. The trick is to make them think they choose their own destination." —Mangara

item.name: Mtenda Lion
item.text: Whenever Mtenda Lion attacks, defending player may pay {U}. If that player does, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by Mtenda Lion this turn.
item.flavorText: "The lion drank that lake right up In thanks, he gave Siti the power to speak with lions and make them leave the goats alone." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Mystical Tutor
item.text: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
item.flavorText: "To the tutors, a ‘poem of sand' was of little account, a ‘poem of ivory,' priceless." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Natural Balance
item.text: Each player who controls six or more lands chooses five lands he or she controls and sacrifices the rest. Each player who controls four or fewer lands may search his or her library for X basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield, where X is five minus the number of lands he or she controls. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.

item.name: Nettletooth Djinn
item.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Nettletooth Djinn deals 1 damage to you.
item.flavorText: "The few of us who survived were denied entry to our camp for two days—so like the pox were the marks we bore." —Travelogue of Najat

item.name: Noble Elephant
item.text: Trample; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
item.flavorText: "Proud am I, / strong am I, / courageous in defending my children / and fierce in punishing what stands in my way." —"So the Elephant Speaks," Zhalfirin song

item.name: Nocturnal Raid
item.text: Black creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "The finest offering of night is not stealth but daring." —Tetlok, Breathstealer

item.name: Null Chamber
item.text: As Null Chamber enters the battlefield, you and an opponent each name a card other than a basic land card. The named cards can't be played.
item.flavorText: Discovered by Femeref mages, the Null Chamber is the ultimate testing ground for the uncreative.

item.name: Pacifism
item.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
item.flavorText: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

item.name: Painful Memories
item.text: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. Put that card on top of that player's library.
item.flavorText: "It is terrible how one brief action can live forever in memory." —Jolrael

item.name: Patagia Golem
item.text: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.
item.flavorText: It scattered falcons like a lion hunting among jackals.

item.name: Paupers' Cage
item.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has two or fewer cards in hand, Paupers' Cage deals 2 damage to him or her.
item.flavorText: A cage may keep you in, but it does not keep the stones out.

item.name: Pearl Dragon
item.text: Flying {1}{W}: Pearl Dragon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
item.flavorText: "They knew Bantau was lost when, to hide the pearl he had found on the beach, he swallowed it—and soon grew wings." —Hakim, Loreweaver

item.name: Phyrexian Dreadnought
item.text: Trample When Phyrexian Dreadnought enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice any number of creatures with total power 12 or greater.

item.name: Phyrexian Purge
item.text: Destroy any number of target creatures. Phyrexian Purge costs 3 life more to cast for each target.
item.flavorText: Only those who have nothing have nothing to fear.

item.name: Phyrexian Tribute
item.text: As an additional cost to cast Phyrexian Tribute, sacrifice two creatures. Destroy target artifact.
item.flavorText: "In your final breath you still have something to offer Phyrexia." —Afari, Tales

item.name: Phyrexian Vault
item.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.
item.flavorText: "The secrets of Phyrexia are expensive. You will pay in brass and bone, steel and sinew." —Kaervek

item.text: W

item.name: Plains
item.text: W

item.name: Plains
item.text: W
